ResponsesInList.Title: Vote for this improvement
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I've suggested an improvement based on this experience : "When searching a user to enroll in a course, it's not possible to search with [lastname] [firstname] order. It works only by putting [firstname] before [lastname]" If you agree with me, you can vote or comment for this request : https://moodle.atlassian.net/browse/MDL-86597 Or better if you want to add a fix for this ? Thanks in advance Best regards Pascal

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle UI crashes after changing permission.
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello, why does the UI of my moodle suddenly crash and became PLAIN HTML after changing permission . Before, my UI works fine. Then I run these following code. 
```text
ls -ld /var/www/web
ls -ld /mnt/volume_sgp1_02/moodledata
```
 After than, I get this result. 
```text
drwxrwsrwx 12 www-data root 4096 Nov 5 22:57 /mnt/volume_sgp1_02/moodledata
```
 I'm using digital ocean volume block storage, then I change permission and run these follow on my terminal, 
```text
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /mnt/volume_sgp1_02/moodledata
sudo find /mnt/volume_sgp1_02/moodledata -type d -exec chmod 770 {} \;
sudo find /mnt/volume_sgp1_02/moodledata -type f -exec chmod 660 {} \;
```
 What I did was, I tried to revert it back, also I delete cache in moodledata and run this. 
```text
sudo rm -rf /mnt/volume_sgp1_02/moodledata/cache/*
sudo rm -rf /mnt/volume_sgp1_02/moodledata/localcache/*
sudo rm -rf /mnt/volume_sgp1_02/moodledata/muc/*
```
 I also restart my nginx server , and my php7.4-fpm but my UI is still plain html.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle UI crashes after changing permission.
ResponsesInList.Text: I fix it, i disabled slash argument, and it works! Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle UI crashes after changing permission.
ResponsesInList.Text: But the problem is, it exposed error in security checks

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle UI crashes after changing permission.
Moodle UI crashes after changing permission.
ResponsesInList.Text: Reset file ownership and permissions to the web server user, then clear Moodle caches to fix the UI crash.

ResponsesInList.Title: Need 'Register' button to disappear after user logged in
ResponsesInList.Text:
I am trying to solve a problem, which is not working as per available documentation. In my home page, I have enabled two buttons: 'Log In' and 'Register'. This has been done in Home Page setting - by maintaining caption text. The text has been hyperlinked with the required page. Once the user log in, these two buttons should disappear. HTML appears as below:
Login
Register
To remove the buttons, in advanced settings, in custom SCSS section, maintaining below: .loggedin . row text-center { display: none !important; } But it does not work. Still both the button appears. Any suggestion? I am using Lambda theme.

ResponsesInList.Title: MDL-72397 Question bank categories show descriptions load too slow
ResponsesInList.Text: I have noticed that the show descriptions toggle loads quite slowly and some users toggle off and on while waiting for the description to show. Would it not be better to have the descriptions just hidden and shown via css so there is no long waiting time for large numbers of question bank categories ?

ResponsesInList.Title: MDL-72397 Question bank categories show descriptions load too slow
ResponsesInList.Text: On the Moodle demo site ( https://qa.moodledemo.net/question/bank/managecategories/category.php?cmid=1227 ) it seems fast. So, what is it about your site that makes it slow? If you can reproduce why it is slow, then that is probably a bug, and should be reported to the bug tracker.

ResponsesInList.Title: UI Scalability for larger student enrollments
ResponsesInList.Text: One of the hallmarks of a good system is scalability. Moodle works well when there is a small learning population. It is however, more challenging and completely manually when there are large training audiences. I prepared a course that required SME review and feedback prior to release. The course has 55 different cohorts, two of which were the SMEs cohorts. I marked the other cohorts as hidden until the SMEs blessed the course's content for release. To unhide each of the cohorts was a complete maddening experience. One at a time and the screen bounced back to the top of the page. No Select All or Unhide All functionality. No letting the admin self-navigate in a very, long page (death scroll). No filters to quickly check that all cohorts were unhidden.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 4.5 question bank: how to see total number of questions?
ResponsesInList.Text: I would like to ask a question regarding the Moodle 4.5 question bank interface. Is there a way to view the total number of questions directly in the interface? I would like to see the total number of questions, including those in subcategories. This feature has always been very useful, as it was available in Moodle 4.1, but I am unable to find it in the current version. Could someone kindly advise how to access this information? Thank you in advance. Best, susana

ResponsesInList.Title: Dynamic Lock/Unlock Icon for Book Activity Completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone, I have created a custom HTML block for a Book activity in Moodle. In this block, I have added two Font Awesome icons ‚Äî one for lock and another for unlock . The behavior I need is: Initially, the lock icon is visible. When the user views the Book activity and Moodle marks it as completed, the icon should dynamically change to the unlock icon without manual refresh. This change should reflect automatically for each user, depending on whether they have completed the Book activity. After I implement this for the Book activity, I would also like to try the same functionality on other activities like Quiz and Page . Can anyone guide me on how to achieve this dynamic icon change based on activity completion status? Thanks in advance for your support. DevD

I have reported it here , it has been confirmed, if anyone has a solution to fix it, I would love to hear it. I have tried to fix it myself, but my coding skills are limited. Many thanks to anyone who looks into the problem! [MDL-86779] Main menu item incorrectly becomes active when selecting from "More" menu - Moodle Tracker

ResponsesInList.Title: comment on the content level
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am having trouble finding a good plugin that allows our platform to support comment sections for each content section of the course. For each resource, there's a comment section about that resource. Any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: comment on the content level
ResponsesInList.Text: The core Comment Block does this for content level - add it to the course page, choose the "Any Page" setting, and it will treat the block as unique for the course page and for each activity. However, it does not treat course "Sections" as unique. A 3rd Party plugin to consider for Section pages might be: https://moodle.org/plugins/block_course_discuss - The advantage to this plugin is it puts the discussion "in" the content area instead of a "block" off to the side ( IF your theme supports that).

ResponsesInList.Title: comment on the content level
ResponsesInList.Text: thank you for the reply it was very helpful, though i would like to know if there's an option where the comment section always get created when a content is created, so i don't have to create it manually each time.

ResponsesInList.Title: comment on the content level
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, once the "Comment Block" is added to the course page with the "any page" setting enabled, then all newly added activities would countinue get a copy of that block. For the 3rd party plugin, I do not think so, I think it has to be manually added to each activity, but I've not used it so I can't say for sure. But if you can download it to try it out, then I'd say treat it like the "Comment Block" by try adding it to the course page with the add to "any page" setting (then, add a comment into it on the course page, such as "Course Page Test". Then, add a new activity to the course and see if it that 3rd party plugin automatically is inside the new activity, and see if it is 'blank' or if it includes that "Course Page test" comment.

ResponsesInList.Title: Hide/Unhide Activities -Moodle 4.3
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm a teacher under 4.3. I frequently hide or show various sections / activities to different groups. The current dropdown box is cumbersome. Frequently, I must leave the screen, scroll-up and refresh the screen to see the options. In my institution, I have a separate Moodle account as a student. I find myself frequently logging in as a student to check.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hide/Unhide Activities -Moodle 4.3
ResponsesInList.Text: Are you talking of the "Switch role to..." menu? I thought once I click on the button representing the role, the site loads automatically. Same thing back to the normal role. Independently of that I also have a test account enrolled as Student to properly test the student view. Having only one account and switching role has its limitations.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hide/Unhide Activities -Moodle 4.3
ResponsesInList.Text: Precisely, well said. No. I do not mean the "Switch role to.. " ( BTW , I strongly advise Teachers to create a separate Moodle account as a Student. Then login and see what Students see. I further suggest using different browsers.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hide/Unhide Activities -Moodle 4.3
ResponsesInList.Text: > No. I do not mean the "Switch role to.. What then? You mean the "three dot" menu, each activity has to its right? OK, then propose an alternative!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hide/Unhide Activities -Moodle 4.3
ResponsesInList.Text: This functionality belongs to the course format. A course format can implement different editing functions. I have not noticed problems like you are describing with Custom sections (topics) format. Are you using something else and have you check whether another course format might fix the issue?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hide/Unhide Activities -Moodle 4.3
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks! This may be the source of the problem. I am under Moodle 4.3 with Course Setting -> Format: Grid, Appearance: Boost.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hide/Unhide Activities -Moodle 4.3
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi James, Grid seems to have the same editing interface a Custom sections, but I can see why you might be doing what you are doing with Grid. Are you hiding sections or activities completely with Availability drop down or adding a group availability condition to restrict them to specific user groups? I think you used to be able to toggle show/hide with one click. The current drop down menu I think was added to make stealth mode also available. However, it adds another click. I maintain the Popup activities course format , and I have been considering adding a feature to editing sections and activities in a modal rather than loading a new page. That may be a easier if you are changing Availability conditions. It also has a new feature that can be enable to push changes to students without them having to reload the page. I would like to better understand your use case to evaluate new features.

ResponsesInList.Title: Hide/Unhide Activities -Moodle 4.3
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I find it cumbersome too because I have to show and hide activities very frequently. Several times during a synchronous session. I wrote (with AI help) a little javascript and CSS to modify my view like this: My Moodle doesn't allow javascript codes so I had to include it in a browser plugin (User javascript and CSS). Now I just have to click to hide/show and also it is very clear which activities are active or not. I'm sure some of you have better solutions for this issue. Anybody care to share? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Hide/Unhide Activities -Moodle 4.3
ResponsesInList.Text: No better solution to share, I did a similar thing you did by applying CSS -- however, I didnt need any javascript, my 4.4 Moodle theme immediately changes the CSS state when I hide/unhide: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=467577

ResponsesInList.Title: Text Appears Strikethrough in Moodle Page, Even Though HTML is Clean
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello Moodle Community, I‚Äôm having an issue where the text inside a Moodle Page resource appears with a strikethrough (line-through) style. Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve already checked and tried: I inspected the HTML source, and there are no `` , `` , `` , or `~~` tags. I used the ‚ÄúClear formatting‚Äù option in the editor. I disabled text filters such as Markdown. I even simplified the HTML to plain `

` tags, but the strikethrough still appears. Here‚Äôs a sample of the HTML I used: ```text < p >üì£ INFO BUAT CALON PESERTA! < p >Smart learners!!! < p >Mau akses materinya? < p >Pastikan kamu udah beresin pembayaran dulu yaa ü§ô < p >üí∏ Langsung hubungi WA: 085961416668 < p >üì≤ Jangan nunggu lama, biar nggak ketinggalan vibes belajarnya~ < p >See u di kelas! üöÄ < p >With Ma Laoshi ``` But the text still shows with a line-through style. I have also tried purging Moodle caches and doing a hard refresh, but no luck. Could this be caused by: A CSS rule in the theme that applies `text-decoration: line-through;` to certain tags, or Some hidden Unicode characters (like U+0336) from copy‚Äìpaste? Has anyone experienced this issue before, and what‚Äôs the best way to troubleshoot or fix it? Thank you very much for your help!

ResponsesInList.Title: Text Appears Strikethrough in Moodle Page, Even Though HTML is Clean
ResponsesInList.Text: Can you use your web-browser developer tools to find where this is coming from? Right-click on some on the strike-through content, and choose 'Inspect ...' and then look at what CSS is applying there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Learning plan templates
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe that my Moodle experience is quite different than other Administrators, as I am the only person who comments on the lack of functionality in the Learning Plan Templates (LPT), Learning Plans (LP) and Competencies. Most days, I shrug my shoulders and carry on. Today (yes, this is a rant) I spent over three hours building a learning plan for a new student. this student has unique competency requirements, so it could not be duplicated from an existing LPT. This one single, student has 106 competencies. Adding each competency is an extremely manual process, but worse than that the Learning plan Template view has no automated ordering capabilities. None. Each competency has to be moved, manually using a UI that looks for like a DOS screen than a modern UI. Just having some method for automated ordering would save me hours every week.

ResponsesInList.Title: Learning plan templates
ResponsesInList.Text: It's way easier with the enrol_Programs plugin, including block_programs. The official version is already enough for most cases. I customized a lot in the plugin and also created an extension for it to fulfill our organizational needs.

ResponsesInList.Text: I am using IOMAD with Moodle and they have multi tenancy features. I have my own designs and wireframes and i want to have course creation and course activity creation pages according to that. And those pages are completely different than what we already have with Moodle. How can I achieve that. I want to complete re-design of admin side pages with limited functionality.

ResponsesInList.Title: Prevent teachers from marking attendance after the same day in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: I need to make attendance prevention for teacher to mark attendence the same day, next day teacher can't mark attendence.

ResponsesInList.Title: Enabling edit mode moves you to the top of the course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Moodle. When making changes to a course, you need to enable edit mode. However, sometimes you want to fix a mistake or add some information, so you enable editing at the location in the course where you want to make changes. Here, Moodle will move you to the top of the course after enabling edit mode, which add more work as you need to scroll down to find the topic or activity that you want to make changes to. I propose a change to the edit mode button behavior, so it remembers your location in the course, thereby enabling me to make changes faster. FYI , I use Firefox for Moodle work. Best, SL

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enabling edit mode moves you to the top of the course
ResponsesInList.Text: This has been fixed in 4.3. When you enter edit mode the page refreshes and it is an Issue in all versions 4.0 to 4.2 that refreshing the page will cause it to scroll to the top. We have fixed this but will not be backporting it at this time as it has caused a number of regressions and other issues. Hope that helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enabling edit mode moves you to the top of the course
ResponsesInList.Text: It's also worth remembering that you don't always need edit mode enabled to make changes to course items - for example, if you wanted to add text to an existing Page or Book or change instructions in an Assignment or Forum etc.. you can do that without edit mode on, just by clicking and going into the settings. (Obvious to you I'm sure, Steffen. but not always to others; hence why I am posting here for future reference.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enabling edit mode moves you to the top of the course
ResponsesInList.Text: I am concerned by the statement: "We have fixed this but will not be backporting it at this time as it has caused a number of regressions and other issues." My understanding, the whole point of having an LTS version is that it should persist as the code trunk and where any fixes/solutions eventually end up prior to moving to the next LTS. We are persisting on 4.1 for this very reason prior to the development of LTS 4.5. It seems like this modification to the edit mode is an actual fix to problem, because this is the behavior that already existed in prior versions of Moodle e.g. 3.11. Since this is a fix and not a new feature, it would seem to make sense that is should be implemented in 4.1. If this is not possible that seems to be an even larger issue in the code management and definition of what truly constitutes an LTS version.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enabling edit mode moves you to the top of the course
ResponsesInList.Text: That is a misunderstanding of what an LTS is. Moodle backports changes to all supported versions, LTS receives security fixes for a much longer period than standard releases. It's also the case not everything can be back ported all the time. In this case there were changes required to address other issues which prevent this fix being ported to earlier versions without a high probability of more breakages

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enabling edit mode moves you to the top of the course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Brett - just following up on this issue. Still having the problem with ver. 4.4.2. Users in Edit mode are not returned to previous spot on the page but rather to the top of the course page. Anything we can do on our end to fix (cache? settings? upgrade more?).

ResponsesInList.Text: Brett - I am on version 4.4.2 and it is still a problem. Flipping editing to On or Off (when teachers are at the bottom of the course page) scrolls the page back to the top still. Is there a setting that was added or is there some javascript that needs to be looked at to resolve? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enabling edit mode moves you to the top of the course

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enabling edit mode moves you to the top of the course
ResponsesInList.Text: Will do.

ResponsesInList.Title: Blank space in questionnaire
ResponsesInList.Text: For info, the correct English translation for words like 'questionnaire' (French), 'question√°rio' (Portugese) is 'Quiz'. In English/Moodle, 'Questionnaire' is something else ( https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_questionnaire ). This is undertandably confusing for speakers of Romance languages (and I could not immediately find which Spanish word, if any, causes the confusion). Anyway, this issue is MDL-85510 . A fix is being worked on.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Course Catalog feature
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Moodle Expert Community, I know many of your are experiencing this very issue as I've seen multiple threads and searches on this topic. Is there any way to have a navigation , course catalog / course grouping like feature in moodle (similar to what Workplace version has: https://docs.moodle.org/500/en/Catalogue ), I would love to know about it. I have been searching day and night for some type of course categorization and filtering feature that would allow end-users to browse courses rather than just have a long list of courses, and I have not found anything yet. Would love to have something for users that can then choose to enroll in those courses (after they filter), and then would also love to use this categorization for users that are auto-enrolled by their organization rules (dynamic cohorts and rules), so that they can also browse the course catalog. Ideally, would be able to select which courses are available for self-enrollment by cohort¬† which I think should already work, but I have not found a course catalog like plugin or feature to use. Please help. Monika

ResponsesInList.Title: Add option to control course display on the front page in course settings
ResponsesInList.Text: Description Currently, there is no option in the course settings to specify whether a course appears on the Moodle front page for non-enrolled users, even when the course is visible. This requires global configuration changes or moving the course to hidden categories, which is cumbersome for teachers. Proposed Improvement Add an "Show on front page" option in the course settings with: Yes : Course appears on the front page for users with permission . No : Course is visible only to enrolled users and does not appear on the front page. Site default : Follows global site settings.

ResponsesInList.Title: Add option to control course display on the front page in course settings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi It would be a good idea to have this option in core Today, it's possible to use a filtercode tag like {mycoursescards} (displays a series of cards for my enrolled courses) or {mycourses} (isplays an unordered list of links to all my enrolled courses). But it's not this the same basic behaviour

ResponsesInList.Title: Course Card Menu to add_remove Star_Hide course feature
ResponsesInList.Text: A few times a year, some industrious student has decided to Star/Hide a course that they do not wish to complete. Moodle should allow at the Site Administrator level to turn off this feature for all course cards.

ResponsesInList.Title: Course Card Menu to add_remove Star_Hide course feature
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Shirley, It's not ideal but in Site administration > Plugins > Blocks > Course overview you can not select any filters, so that no course filters display on the My courses page and nothing happens if a student tries removing a course from view. However, it would a lot better, as you say to be able to turn off the feature and not show the options on course cards. I searched the Moodle Tracker but couldn't find an issue for this. Maybe you can create an improvement issue for it?

ResponsesInList.Title: Course Card Menu to add_remove Star_Hide course feature
ResponsesInList.Text: I have created tracker MDL-85371 to provide from Site Administrative a method to turn off the Star/Hide feature from the Course Card. Please consider providing additional comments/feedback and voting up the tracker!

ResponsesInList.Title: Course Card Menu to add_remove Star_Hide course feature
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Shirley for creating MDL-85371 . It has my vote!

ResponsesInList.Title: New WWW notification icon? Why the highlighter?
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear UX Team, I've recently upgraded my Moodles from 4.3 to 4.5, and immediately noticed this change. Is there any reason why the individual WWW notification icon should be the highlighter now, and the bell any core? I'm finding this strange and inconsistent with the main bell icon in the top bar. Could this be a bug affecting Moodle 4.5 and above? Many thanks for any clarification. Kind regards, Przemek

ResponsesInList.Title: Drag feedback files in a submission activity - to many students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone, I hope your hearts are filled with peace and joy! Please, I would like to ask for help with the following procedure: I- The teacher corrects the file sent by the student (in a submission activity) and after all the files have been corrected, the teacher enters the activity and chooses "send feedback files" to each of his students. Problems: II- The number of clicks and the time spent on this action is enormous! We are using Moodle 4.5.1. What happens today: a) the teacher selects the student b) a group of commands opens at the bottom of the screen and the teacher needs to click on the 3 dots to see the item "send feedback files" c) a drop-down menu opens where the teacher needs to click on "save changes" d) finally the place where the teacher will put his feedback file for the student appears e) Imagine this bunch of clicks being made for 100 students... Within "annotate PDF" we have the item "grades", the item "feedback comments" and the item "feedback files". When we enter the activity - submissions, we also have the place for the teacher to put the "grades" and the place for the teacher to write the "feedback comments", but we do not have the place for the teacher to upload the "feedback files". Why don't we make it possible to upload "feedback files" to the activity, under the "submissions" item, as is the case with "grades" and "feedback comments"? It would be much simpler and faster, and teachers would save time. III- the image of how it looks today. IV- the suggestion of how it could look Marcelo.

ResponsesInList.Title: Meta-Course - Hidden Courses visible to the enrolled students but with "Hidden from students" still shown
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, I have created a meta course and three "sub" courses that are hidden by default to students but visible to enrolled students of the meta course. For each subcourse I choose the meta-course enrollment as an option and I've added the role students as being able to view the hidden course, in such a way I can by default "hide" all the sub-courses to everyone, however once a student gets enrolled in the meta-course he can access all the sub-courses. This works fine except for one small UX annoyance, which is the phrase "Hidden from students" displayed below the course description (see attached image). This is annoying because it may somehow mislead students and give the impression that there is something dirty going on. In short, the students enrolled in the subcourse via the meta course should not see this "Hidden from students" sentence. Any suggestions? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Meta-Course - Hidden Courses visible to the enrolled students but with "Hidden from students" still shown
ResponsesInList.Text: Are your viewing this with a student role or an administrative role?

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Meta-Course - Hidden Courses visible to the enrolled students but with "Hidden from students" still shown
ResponsesInList.Text: student role. The three sub-courses belong to a category for which I allowed students to view hidden courses (see attachment) .

ResponsesInList.Title: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey guys, I‚Äôve really been struggling with the UI, I often work late at night or early in the morning and the background is searing my retinas. I have a dark reader plugin that works fine for every other site, but moodle goes back to white every time I click anything. I understand we‚Äôre a captive audience but for the sake of all of our eyes‚Ä¶ please fix this. At the very least stop breaking dark reader‚Ä¶ before I go insane, please fix this

ResponsesInList.Title: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Adam. I also wish we had a dark mode in Moodle. We already have a ticket for this issue in the Tracker: MDL-68037 . However, I think that we need to be able to upgrade to Bootstrap 5 first before we can start working on this. Feel free to follow and participate in MDL-68037 and in the Bootstrap 5 epic ( MDL-71979 ) to stay up to date with the progress of the dark mode feature. Hope this helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: You can implement a simple version of a dark mode yourself, by adding a bit of CSS and JavaScript to Moodle. See: https://gigers.com/blog/dark-mode-fuer-moodle/ (use Google translate to get an English version).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Adam, Completely understand your frustration‚Äîworking late or early with bright screens can be tough. While the Moodle community works toward a built-in solution for dark mode, I thought I‚Äôd mention that the Edwiser RemUI theme already comes with a beautifully implemented dark mode. If you‚Äôre interested, feel free to check it out or let me know. Happy to share more details, including the libraries we use, to help speed things up for Moodle Core as well! Hope this helps in the meantime! üòä

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: While the Edwiser RemUI theme is a commercial product, the CSS and JavaScript approach described by Matthias Giger is free !

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: I appreciate the resources y‚Äôall. I‚Äôll just continue toggling my dark reader on and off to reset it for now. Between my full-time job, part-time class workload and plethora of neglected personal projects; I have plenty of things to work on. I really hope that bootstrap 5 epic gets prioritized

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: Both, the new version of the FREE Boost Magnific theme has an easy to use 'dark mode'. the new version of the FREE Degrade theme has an easy to use 'dark mode'. Many thanks to Eduardo Kraus.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: Yesterday, I officially launched the moodle-local_boost_dark repository and submitted it for approval on Moodle Tracker under reference CONTRIB-9761 . This plugin is designed to provide a dark theme that integrates seamlessly with Boost and any other Bootstrap-based theme. The core innovation lies in the use of the [data-bs-theme] tag from Bootstrap, which enables smooth and standardized switching between light and dark themes. This approach ensures the implementation is flexible and adheres to Bootstrap best practices, allowing compatibility with future developments and other systems utilizing the framework.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: yes, you should See: https:/ / gigers.com/ blog /dark-mode-fuer-moodle/ (use Google translate to get an English version).

ResponsesInList.Title: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Moodle community! üòä Regarding the solution you mentioned, it uses the magic of CSS with `html { filter: invert(100%) hue-rotate(180deg); }` . This approach is interesting because it quickly transforms the appearance of any HTML to its inverse colors. But it has some issues... When using this filter, the colors of images and icons also get inverted, which can result in something a bit... let's say, psychedelic! üåàüòÇ. Because of this, while it's a quick shortcut, it may not be ideal for a professional or educational environment where a polished visual is needed. I tested this on the Moodle forum and applied the code. Take a look at the result I got in the attached image. It's fun but not very practical for production. Now, take a look at the difference when using the Boost Dark plugin, which you can also download from GitHub , and see the difference: Eduardo Kraus Teacher and Programmer

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dark Mode???
ResponsesInList.Text: Adam no worries, You can implement a simple version of a dark mode yourself, by adding a bit of CSS and JavaScript to Moodle. See at gigers.com (use Google translate to get an English version where necessary). I did it from https://storiescastle.com/the-boy-who-cried-wolf-a-bedtime-story-for-kids/

ResponsesInList.Title: Reset course completion criteria without deleting existing completions
ResponsesInList.Text: We regularly experience scenarios where customers need to update course completion criteria (for example a new activity has been added), however users with existing completion are not required to complete the new activity. The ability to reset course completion without deleting existing completions would be so valuable and would save hours of work to create new courses and enable completion reports to be run on the same course. I have posted an improvement suggestion and would appreciate if you could vote for it: MDL-84329 Thank you

ResponsesInList.Title: tinyMCE Bootstrap Plugin in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, Our Instructional Designers are clamboring for the ability to add Bootstrap components to their courses ( Activities and Resources) by having it integrated into their Moodle editor. I have been trying to install a Bootstrap plugin for the tinyMCE editor , and while I've made some progress, I'm stuck at the "instantiation" step. I wonder if anyone has been able to successfully integrate third-party tinyMCE plugins with their Moodle sites. Or maybe there are other options we can consider. Thanks! Darren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: tinyMCE Bootstrap Plugin in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Unfortunately, it is difficult for the community to assist because the TinyMCE Bootstrap Plugin is a paid plugin. However, you can check the file `bootstrap5/lang/tiny_bootstrap5.php` to confirm if the key `pluginname` is present. Additionally, I recommend contacting the developer directly through the support channels available on the official website.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: tinyMCE Bootstrap Plugin in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Eduardo, And thanks for your reply. While my problem is specifically with the TinyMCE Bootstrap plugin, my question to the community is more generic... I wonder if anyone has been able to successfully integrate third-party tinyMCE plugins with their Moodle sites? I suppose what I mean by that is, besides the plugins that come packaged with tinyMCE (and a standard Moodle install) are there other Moodle admins out there who are successfully extending tinMCE with additional plugins (paid or not)? There are plenty of tinyMCE "plugins" that (from my limited point of view) just drop into Moodle and install right from moodle.org. I'm curious if folks are using tinyMCE plugins that aren't specifically packaged for Moodle. üòÄ If I'm heading down a road that no one has returned from, I'll turn around now and start looking for other solutions. üòÄ Thanks! Darren

ResponsesInList.Title: Image Aspect Ratios
ResponsesInList.Text: This is just a rant to complain about Course Image aspect ratios. They are different in so many places. From the documentation: The recommended image size for a Moodle course is around 400 to 800 pixels. Or 1:2. Here are the aspect ratios in the following areas: My courses - 10 : 7 Recently accessed courses - ¬†191 : 75 Catalogue - 265‚à∂144 Program (Workplace) 3:2 This is frustrating. I believe there are other images that are displayed in different aspect ratios like Program images and badges.

ResponsesInList.Title: Image Aspect Ratios
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Amanda! üòä First of all, could you let me know which theme you are using? Sometimes, the behavior of images can vary depending on the selected theme, as each one may have its own settings and specific dimensions. Additionally, could you share a screenshot of the areas where you notice these differences? This will help us better understand what's happening and find a more targeted solution. Sometimes, the theme's CSS can be adjusted to harmonize proportions and avoid these visual inconsistencies. Eduardo Kraus Teacher and programmer

ResponsesInList.Title: Add "Affected user" filter in course logs
ResponsesInList.Text: (I'm not sure if this is the right forum for this, but maybe the usability part?) In the logs one can select user in the filter to view their logs in a course, but what is often wanted - at least for us - is the affected user . And to find that, one has to go through all the log posts. There's a column for Affected user, but no filter. Here is a suggestion to add Affected user as a filter in the logs: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-82080 Please vote if you find that a useful suggestion.
